title:
Consider the reaction:

C(s) + $$H_2 O\left(gight)$$ ⇌ CO(g) + $$\operatorname{H_2}\left(gight)$$

Given that at 298K:
- ∆G° $$=$$ $$110.5$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$ for the reaction above
- Heats of formation (∆$$H_f$$°) at 298K:
- $$H_2 O\left(gight)$$ $$=$$ $$-241.8$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
- CO(g) $$=$$ $$-110.5$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
- $$\operatorname{H_2}\left(gight)$$ and C(s) are elements in their standard state, so their heats of formation are $$0$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$.
body: Show your work for all the problems and save the document. You will be asked to submit the work for credit. Please complete the entire module in a single sitting.\n For each answer input box, enter only a numeric response without commas, units, or additional formatting.
